setting.name: ADMIN_PASSWORD
setting.description: This is the admin password

setting.name: AUTOLOGIN_ENABLE
setting.description: controls whether the set attempts to automatically login to the proxy server. YES - turns on the auto login feature. NO - turns off the auto login feature. USE_AUTOLOGIN_ID - enables the auto login id feature using the userid specified in AUTOLOGIN_ID_KEY01 and the password

setting.name: BLF_RESOURCE_LIST_URI
setting.description: Sip Uri for BLF resource on server

setting.name: BLF_ENABLE
setting.description: This flag is used to completely disable the BLF feature. If set to N, the BLF feature is disabled (BLF_RESOURCE_LIST_URI parameter is ignored).

setting.name: AUTO_UPDATE
setting.description: is a command to enable or disable the automatic updating of the IP Phone 1140E with SIP Firmware configuration files from the Prov Server. Enabling this command causes the IP Phone 1140E with SIP Firmware to check for updates once every day. Default is disabled.

setting.name: AUTO_UPDATE_TIME
setting.description: is the actual time in seconds, starting from midnight, before an automatic update occurs. Each IP Phone 1140E adds random numbers to the time specified by this command so every IP Phone 1140E does not try to access the provisioning server at the same time. By default the automatic update feature is disabled (see AUTO_UPDATE_RANGE). x - the time after midnight that the automatic update occurs.

setting.name: AUTO_UPDATE_TIME_RANGE
setting.description: is the range in hours, from the AUTO_UPDATE_TIME whereby an IP Phone 1140E checks for updates from the server. The default range is 1 hour. x - the range in hours when the IP Phone checks for updates from the server. The range can be from 1 to 6 hours

setting.name: RECOVERY_LEVEL
setting.description: controls the phone recovery if the phone hits any Major or Critical error. Default is 255, which is equivalent to the recovery level of 2.

setting.name: PORT_MIRROR_ENABLE
setting.description: Enable or Disable PC Port Mirroring

setting.name: LOGSIP_ENABLE
setting.description: YES - activate logger of SIP packets NO - deactivate logger of SIP packets. This is the default option.

setting.name: SSH
setting.description: Configuration of the SSH server on the phone.

setting.name: SFTP
setting.description: Configuration of the SFTP server on the phone.

setting.name: SFTP_READ_PATTERNS
setting.description: File types allowed to read using SFTP. File extensions allowed to write(put) from SIP client

setting.name: SFTP_WRITE_PATTERNS
setting.description: File types allowed to write using SFTP

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN1
setting.description: Please enter valid DNS host name or IP address, for example server.domain.org, 10.1.1.25

setting.name: SERVER_IP1_1
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT1_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT1_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT1_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_IP1_2
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT1_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT1_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT1_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_RETRIES1
setting.description: Confirms the number of retries for each domain. The default number of retries is 3

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN1_PROTOS
setting.description: Connection to each sip domain can be fine tuned to allow for use of three protocols, UDP, TCP, and TLS. This configuration value will allow the administrator to specify the allowed protocols that the phone may use.

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN2
setting.description: Please enter valid DNS host name or IP address, for example server.domain.org, 10.1.1.25

setting.name: SERVER_IP2_1
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT2_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT2_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT2_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_IP2_2
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT2_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT2_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT2_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_RETRIES2
setting.description: Confirms the number of retries for each domain. The default number of retries is 3

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN2_PROTOS
setting.description: Connection to each sip domain can be fine tuned to allow for use of three protocols, UDP, TCP, and TLS. This configuration value will allow the administrator to specify the allowed protocols that the phone may use.

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN3
setting.description: Please enter valid DNS host name or IP address, for example server.domain.org, 10.1.1.25

setting.name: SERVER_IP3_1
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT3_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT3_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT3_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_IP3_2
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT3_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT3_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT3_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_RETRIES3
setting.description: Confirms the number of retries for each domain. The default number of retries is 3

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN3_PROTOS
setting.description: Connection to each sip domain can be fine tuned to allow for use of three protocols, UDP, TCP, and TLS. This configuration value will allow the administrator to specify the allowed protocols that the phone may use.

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN4
setting.description: Please enter valid DNS host name or IP address, for example server.domain.org, 10.1.1.25

setting.name: SERVER_IP4_1
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT4_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT4_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT4_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_IP4_2
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT4_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT4_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT4_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_RETRIES4
setting.description: Confirms the number of retries for each domain. The default number of retries is 3

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN4_PROTOS
setting.description: Connection to each sip domain can be fine tuned to allow for use of three protocols, UDP, TCP, and TLS. This configuration value will allow the administrator to specify the allowed protocols that the phone may use.

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN5
setting.description: Please enter valid DNS host name or IP address, for example server.domain.org, 10.1.1.25

setting.name: SERVER_IP5_1
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT5_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT5_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT5_1
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of first proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_IP5_2
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: SERVER_PORT5_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling UDP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TCP_PORT5_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TCP port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_TLS_PORT5_2
setting.description: Remote SIP signaling TLS port of second proxy server

setting.name: SERVER_RETRIES5
setting.description: Confirms the number of retries for each domain. The default number of retries is 3

setting.name: SIP_DOMAIN5_PROTOS
setting.description: Connection to each sip domain can be fine tuned to allow for use of three protocols, UDP, TCP, and TLS. This configuration value will allow the administrator to specify the allowed protocols that the phone may use.

setting.name: SIP_PING
setting.description: The SIP_PING configuration value is used to maintain server heartbeat detection and to keep a firewall pinhole open. When used for server heartbeat detection, the IP Phone 1140E periodically pings the SIP Proxy and awaits a response. When three attempts to ping the SIP Proxy fail, the IP Phone 1140E begins a failover process and attempts to connect to the next configured SIP Proxy IP in the same domain.When a NAT TRAVERSAL method is selected, the SIP_PING configuration value also helps keep a firewall pinhole open.

setting.name: SIP_UDP_PORT
setting.description: Local SIP signaling UDP listening port

setting.name: SIP_TCP_PORT
setting.description: Local SIP signaling TCP listening port

setting.name: SIP_TLS_PORT
setting.description: Local SIP signaling TLS listening port

setting.name: E911_USERNAME
setting.description: username to be used for E911 login when E911 dialed without a user logged in

setting.name: E911_PASSWORD
setting.description: password to be used for E911 login when E911 dialed without a user logged in on set

setting.name: E911_PROXY
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address for E911 proxy server, for example: 10.1.1.0, proxy to be used for E911 login when E911 dialed without a user logged in

setting.name: E911_TXLOC
setting.description: Specifies which SIP message type is used to transmit E911 call location information. If set to INVITE, the INVITE SIP message used to initiate an E911 call will contain the location information. If set to REGISTER, the REGISTER of the login used for making the E911 call will have sent the location info

setting.name: ALLOW_EMERGENCY_PRIORITY_HEADER
setting.description: Indicate whether "Priority: emergency" header must be added to emergency calls or not.

setting.name: AUTH_METHOD
setting.description: is used to configure the SIP authentication method. AUTH - only authenticates (username/password) AUTH_INT - authentication plus integrity checking (an MD5 hash of the entity is also computed and checked).

setting.name: ADDR_BOOK_MODE
setting.description: is a command to choose the address book that is used to search for other users. The default setting is NETWORK. NETWORK - downloads the user’s address book from the network (MCS). New address book entries are uploaded to the network. LOCAL - creates a user address book and stores it locally on the IP Phone BOTH - attempts to download a network address book and keep a copy on the IP Phone. If a network address book is available, the IP Phone 1140E functions as if NETWORK mode has been selected.

setting.name: HOLD_TYPE
setting.description: is used to select the protocol to hold a call. The default setting is RFC3261. RFC2543 - RFC 2543 is a standard protocol of the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF). RFC3261 - RFC3261 is a standard protocol of the IETF

setting.name: TRANSFER_TYPE
setting.description: is used to configure the IP Phone 1140E to activate Nortel conference server-assisted attended transfers, instead of the industry standard method of attended transfers. The default setting is MCS. MCS - the typical attended transfer used by Nortel proxies. MCS uses a conference server to do the attended transfer. STANDARD - the standard method of a transfer. This method does not involve a conference server.

setting.name: REDIRECT_TYPE
setting.description: is a command used to select different protocols for set redirection. The default setting is MCS. MCS - when the IP Phone 1140E receives either 301(moved permanently) or 302 (moved temporarily) during registration, it is assumed the IP Phone 1140E is moved to a new MCS 5100 system (proxy+registrar) and all subsequent messages are sent to the new address. RFC3261 - the IP Phone 1140E assumes that, if during registration, a 301 (moved permanently) is received, the message contains a new registrar address. The IP Phone 1140E tries to register to the registrar using the existing proxy.

setting.name: ENABLE_3WAY_CALL
setting.description: is a flag to enable or disable local phone-based three-way calling for three-party conferences. YES - enables local (phone-based) three-way calling for three-party conferences. YES is the default. NO - disables local (phone-based) three-way calling.

setting.name: DISABLE_PRIVACY_UI
setting.description: is a flag to disable the privacy setting in UI menus. Disabling the privacy setting in UI menus disables the user ability to set privacy options. YES - disables the privacy setting in the UI menus. NO - enables the privacy setting in the UI menus. NO is the default.

setting.name: ENABLE_PRACK
setting.description: PRACK is utilized to make some SIP messages reliable and requires that an ACK be sent with many SIP messages. ENABLE_PRACK is often utilized to verify that early media is being received. See RFC 3262 for details. Note 1: ENABLE_PRACK must be set to NO when connected to the MCS 5100 Release 3.5 system. Note 2: ENABLE_PRACK is provisioned after user logout. NO - disables PRACK and is the default value. YES - enables PRACK.

setting.name: DISABLE_OCT_ENDDIAL
setting.description: is a flag used to configure the pound (#) key. The default setting is YES. YES - the pound (#) key initiates dialing when pressed after a telephone number is entered. NO - the pound (#) key functions as any other digit or character on the dial pad typically used in networks that use vertical service codes or access codes.

setting.name: FORCE_OCT_ENDDIAL
setting.description: is a flag used to override attempts to change the function of the pound (#) key on the Graphical User Interface (GUI). The default setting is NO. YES - overrides attempts to change the function of the pound (#) key on the GUI. NO - does not override a change of the function of the pound (#) key on the GUI.

setting.name: DEF_AUDIO_QUALITY
setting.description: is a command used for setting the default audio quality used for each new call. Audio quality can be changed when the call is active. If this command is not present in the configuration file, the IP Phone 1140E uses High quality as its default value. The possible parameters for this command are High, Medium, and Low. If any other parameter is entered or these commands are misspelled, the IP Phone 1140E uses High as the default setting. The following codecs are used for each selection: Low - G729 ptime 30. Medium - G711 ptime 30. High - G711 ptime 20.

setting.name: ENABLE_BT
setting.description: is a flag to enable and disable Bluetooth support in the IP Phone 1140E. YES - enables Bluetooth. NO - disables Bluetooth. The default is NO. Note that the IP Phone 1140E hardware does not support Bluetooth and this command is ignored.

setting.name: PROXY_CHECKING
setting.description: enables and disables extra security checking when incoming requests are sent to the IP Phone 1140E. The IP Phone 1140E with SIP Firmware always sends requests through an outgoing proxy. However, it is possible, through this configuration, to be able to accept an incoming request directly or through an incoming proxy. YES - means that the request must come directly from the proxy server. YES is the default to enable proxy checking. NO - means the request can be sent directly to the IP Phone 1140E. (NO is only suitable in a few situations).

setting.name: DISTINCTIVE_RINGING
setting.description: YES - turns on the distinctive ringing feature. This is the default option. NO - turns off the distinctive ringing feature.

setting.name: CALL_WAITING
setting.description: SPEAKER - the call waiting tone is played on the phone speaker. This is the default option. STREAM - the call waiting tone is injected into the stream played on the transducer in use for the active call

setting.name: USE_RPORT
setting.description: YES - allows the phone to work from behind and/or in front of a symmetrical NAT with servers and/or clients that support RFC 3581. NO - disables implementation of support for RFC 3581. This is the default option. Note: To provision USE_RPORT, the IP Phone 1140 must be rebooted after the device configuration file is updated. To force a hard reboot after the device configuration file is updated set FORCE_REBOOT YES

setting.name: MAX_RING_TIME
setting.description: an integer between 30 and 600 that sets the number of seconds for incoming calls to ring before ignoring them. The default value is 120.

setting.name: EXP_MODULE_ENABLE
setting.description: YES - the set will detect and enable an expansion module. NO - the set will not detect an expansion module. This is the default option.

setting.name: ENABLE_UPDATE
setting.description: YES - enables UPDATE message support and adds “UPDATE” to ALLOW header. This is the default option. NO - disables UPDATE message support.

setting.name: PROMPT_ON_LOCATION_OTHER
setting.description: YES - prompt the user to select new location if location “other” was previously selected. NO - do not prompt the user to select new location if location “other” was previously selected. This is the default option

setting.name: RTP_PORT_RANGE
setting.description: The maximum RTP port The RTP port value. configuration parameters must satisfy the constraints that (RTP_MAX_PORT - RTP_MIN_PORT) is greater than or equal to 100 and less than 1000.

setting.name: DEFAULT_CFWD_NOTIFY
setting.description: is used to configure the "ring splash" which occurs when either local call forwarding (MCS 5100) or network-based call forwarding have been enabled (CS 2000, CS 2100). If this configuration value is enabled, the IP Phone 1140E plays an abbreviated ring tone to remind the user that a call has been forwarded. This configuration value only effects users when their user profile is first created, unless the FORCE_CFWD_NOTIFY flag is also used. The default setting is NO YES - a brief ring splash plays when a call is forwarded. NO - the ring splash is not be played.

setting.name: FORCE_CFWD_NOTIFY
setting.description: allows the administrator to force the behavior of the DEFAULT_CFWD_NOTIFY value on all users who login to the IP Phone 1140E. The default setting is NO. YES - the DEFAULT_CFWD_NOTIFY configuration value is forced into effect for the user. NO - the configuration value is not be forced into effect for the user

setting.name: AUTOCLEAR_NEWCALL_MSG
setting.description: Used to set the idle screen missed calls notification mode. Y means that the notification is cleared as soon as the inbox is entered (without needing to visit all missed entries). N requires user to select each missed call in his inbox to have the notification cleared.

setting.name: MEMCHECK_PERIOD
setting.description: Specify time period for activating Memory Monitor after boot time or the last Memory checking

setting.name: KEEP_ALIVE_TYPE
setting.description: Type of keep alive to use (OS or CRLF). Please note that CRLF is always active no matter what values are used.

setting.name: CONN_KEEP_ALIVE
setting.description: Allows the administrator to specify the amount of time which should be used for the connnection-keep-alive pings.

setting.name: REGISTER_RETRY_TIME
setting.description: Base time to wait in seconds before retrying a failed connection. When the phone has lost connection with a proxy, this value will be the default amount of time the phone should wait before attempting to reconnect with the proxy.

setting.name: REGISTER_RETRY_MAXTIME
setting.description: Max time to wait in seconds before retrying a failed connection. When the phone has lost connection with a proxy, this value will be the maximum amount of time the phone will be prepared to wait before attempting to re-register witth the SIP proxy. After this value has been reached, the phone will continue to use a random value between 50 and 100% of this maximum value

setting.name: SELECT_LAST_INCOMING
setting.description: YES - Multiline function select incoming call; No - Multiline function already selected call remain unchanged.

setting.name: LOGINALPHA_ENABLE
setting.description: This parameter allows the system administrator to set the login and logout of the phone to be in either alphanumeric mode or numeric mode.

setting.name: ENABLE_ANSWER_MODE
setting.description: Enable or disable answer mode support, default is ENABLE

setting.name: ANSWER_MODE_MAXALLOWADDR
setting.description: Answer mode maximum allowed address ranges from 0 to 200, default is 100.

setting.name: ANSWER_MODE_MICMUTE
setting.description: Mute mic when call is auto answered, default is NO.

setting.name: DOD_ENABLE
setting.description: DoD network enable or disable

setting.name: DSCP_OAM
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format.

setting.name: DSCP_MEDIA_FLASHOVERRRIDE
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format. When MLPP service is enabled and precedence level is Flash Override, all outgoing media packet is marked with this value. Usaually do not recommend to change this value.

setting.name: DSCP_MEDIA_FLASH
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format. When MLPP service is enabled and precedence level is Flash, all outgoing media packet is marked with this value. Usaually do not recommend to change this value.

setting.name: DSCP_MEDIA_IMMEDIATE
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format. When MLPP service is enabled and precedence level is Immediate, all outgoing media packet is marked with this value. Usaually do not recommend to change this value.Usaually do not recommend to change this value.

setting.name: DSCP_MEDIA_PRIORITY
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format. When MLPP service is enabled and precedence level is Priority, all outgoing media packet is marked with this value. Usaually do not recommend to change this value.

setting.name: MLPP_NETWORK_DOMAIN
setting.description: The network domain (DSN) of the user to be added to the INVITE message of outgoing calls.- for now we will have DSN only as a drop down option. However, there are plans in the future to support DRSN.

setting.name: MLPP_PRECEDENCE_DOMAIN
setting.description: The local precedence domain of the user to be added to the INVITE message of outgoing calls.- Precedence Domain will accept hexadecimal characters only- since AS5300 has that limitation in place for a user's precedence domain as well. Default will be 6 zeros "000000". So we can have this as a text box which can have 6 hex values entered in.

setting.name: CALL_WAITING_TONE
setting.description: 1- two-beep periodic tone 0 -single buzz

setting.name: MAX_APPEARANCE
setting.description: Maximum appearances(number of calls they can handle) each user on the phone may have

setting.name: CALL_ORIGIN_BUSY
setting.description: The user should not be interrupted (presented with an incoming call) when entering address of outbound call. Intended for DoD.

setting.name: DISABLE_SPKRPHN
setting.description: Disables the speakerphone for all non-911 calls. Intended for DoD.

setting.name: SLOW_START_200OK
setting.description: Sends SDP offer in 200 OK only If enabled. This is intended for DoD and will behave this way for all communication including PRACK

setting.name: FM_PROFILES_ENABLE
setting.description: Is used for File Manager. Specifies whether a user is able to copy/ delete files from/to Profile Manager

setting.name: FM_LANGS_ENABLE
setting.description: Is used for File Manager. Specifies whether a user is able to copy/delete files from/to Languages Manager

setting.name: FM_SOUNDS_ENABLE
setting.description: Is used for File Manager. Specifies whether a user is able to copy/ delete files from/to Tone Manager

setting.name: FM_IMAGES_ENABLE
setting.description: Is used for File Manager. Specifies whether a user is able to copy/ delete files from/to Images Manager

setting.name: FM_CERTS_ENABLE
setting.description: Is used for File Manager. Specifies whether a user is able to copy/ delete files from/to Certificate Manager

setting.name: HOTLINE_ENABLE
setting.description: Enables or disables Hotline feature

setting.name: HOTLINE_URL
setting.description: sip uri or phone number e.g. 6139675000

setting.name: IPV6_ENABLE
setting.description: Enable IPv6 functionality in a dual mode

setting.name: PREFER_IPV6
setting.description: If NO, when there is a choice between IPv4 and IPv6 address, the set will choose the IPv4 address. This is the default state

setting.name: IPV6_STATELESS
setting.description: Enable IPv6 stateless autoconfiguration. This enables self configuration in a routed IPv6 network via router discovery messages

setting.name: IPV6_ENABLE_GUI
setting.description: Enable IPv6 user configuration interface in the Device Configuration screen

setting.name: DEF_LANG
setting.description: is a command used for setting the default language. Select one of the supported languages from the language list downloaded. Note that the corresponding language file must be downloaded and stored in the IP Phone 1140E through the [LANGUAGE] section in Provisioning. If the language file is not stored in the IP Phone 1140E, the default language English is used.

setting.name: DEF_LANG
setting.description: is a command used for setting the default language. Select one of the supported languages from the language list downloaded. Note that the corresponding language file must be downloaded and stored in the IP Phone 1140E through the [LANGUAGE] section in Provisioning. If the language file is not stored in the IP Phone 1140E, the default language English is used.

setting.name: TECH_SUPPORT_ADDRESS
setting.description: Please enter a valid sip address

setting.name: TECH_SUPPORT_LABEL
setting.description: 7 char string for the support soft key label

setting.name: MADN_TIMER
setting.description: is used to set the MADN polling timer interval (the interval at which the IP Phone 1140E attempts to determine the MADN group of the logged-in user). The minimum value for the polling interval is 900 seconds (15 minutes). The default value is 1800.

setting.name: MADN_DIALOG
setting.description: is used to set the SIP URI or the GROUP DN for the subscription to the dialog event. The default value is NO. YES - subscribes to the dialog event using the SIP URI of the user. NO - subscribes to the dialog event using the group of the user. Note: The SIP URI is used to subscribe for MADN support for CS 2000.

setting.name: SCA_APPEARANCES
setting.description: sets the maximum number of appearances that will be used for outgoing calls by the Shared Call Appearance (SCA) group.

setting.name: SCA_BROADWORKS
setting.description: YES - activates the Broadsoft Shared Call Appearance (SCA) feature. NO - deactivates the Broadsoft Shared Call Appearance (SCA) feature. This is the default option

setting.name: SCA_HOLD_BEHAVIOUR
setting.description: sets the default behavior of the hold button when user determined behavior does not exist. When a user creates a new profile the default behavior is taken from this setting. After the creation of a new profile this configuration setting is not used. The default option is PUBLIC. The SCA feature is supported on BroadWorks servers.

setting.name: VMAIL
setting.description: is the voice mail address which can be the URI or the DN number of the voice mail server. This command takes a string as a parameter. This is the default link for a new user profile only. Individual users can customize the link through Prefs, Message Options, Voice Mail Settings. This command has no effect on the user profiles after it is created. vmail_number - the number or URI of the voicemail server.

setting.name: VMAIL_DELAY
setting.description: is a delay, configured in milliseconds, between when the voice mail server answers the call and the start of dialing the voice mail user ID. The default value is 1000ms. x - the delay in milliseconds

setting.name: TOVM_SOFTKEY_ENABLE
setting.description: enabled or disabled YES - enables the toVM soft key on the phone. NO - disables the toVM soft key on the phone.

setting.name: TOVM_VOICEMAIL_ALIAS
setting.description: customizes the user ID of the SIP URI of the voice mail system.

setting.name: TOVM_VOICEMAIL_PARAM
setting.description: customizes the parameter name of the SIP URI of the voice mail system.

setting.name: IM_MODE
setting.description: is used to configure the mode of instant messaging (IM). The default setting is ENCRYPTED. ENCRYPTED - instant messages are sent encrypted. TEXT - instant messages are sent as text. SIMPLE - instant messages are sent using SIP for Instant Messaging and Presence Leveraging Extensions (SIMPLE) protocol. DISABLED - instant messaging is turned off and no instant messages can sent or received.

setting.name: DEF_DISPLAY_IM
setting.description: enables or disables the display of instant messages (IM). The default setting is NO. YES - enables display of IMs. NO - disables display of IMs.

setting.name: IM_NOTIFY
setting.description: is used to turn on or off the Blue LED indicator upon receipt of an instant message. YES - the Blue LED functions when an instant message is received. NO - the Blue LED does not function when an instant message is received.

setting.name: SECONDARY_LOGOUT_ENABLE
setting.description: Whether or not secondary users can be logged out with the primary user's password.

setting.name: LOGOUT_WITHOUT_PASSWORD
setting.description: Whether or not logging out requires a password.

setting.name: NAT_SIGNALLING
setting.description: indicates the type of protocol used for NAT traversal in the signaling port. The IP Phone 1140E with SIP Firmware supports two methods of NAT traversal of the signaling path: SIP_PING and STUN NONE - If the value is not set to None, this parameter overrides the value of the parameter SIP_PING in the device configuration file. SIP_PING - a Nortel proprietary NAT traversal protocol. Note that SIP_PING only supports NAT traversal in the signaling port. STUN - the most common NAT traversal method.

setting.name: NAT_MEDIA
setting.description: indicates the type of protocol used for NAT traversal in the media ports. The default is NONE. NONE - is the default and disables NAT_MEDIA. STUN - the most common NAT traversal protocol for the media (RTP and Real-time Control Protocol [RTCP]) port. x - is the binding lifetime in seconds.

setting.name: NAT_TTL
setting.description: is used for future development. Currently, the default value is 2 minutes (120 seconds) and SIP IP Phones 1120E/1140E do not process or use the value defined in NAT_TTL [x]. SIP IP Phones 1120E/1140E always ping the ports at regular intervals of 60 seconds regardless of the NAT_TTL value.

setting.name: STUN_SERVER_IP1
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address for STUN server, for example: 10.1.1.0.NAT traversal using STUN protocol requires a STUN server in the public internet. Two STUN server IPs can be provisioned.

setting.name: STUN_SERVER_PORT1
setting.description: is the port number used corresponding to STUN_SERVER_IP1. The default port number is 3478.

setting.name: STUN_SERVER_IP2
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address for STUN server, for example: 10.1.1.0.NAT traversal using STUN protocol requires a STUN server in the public internet. Two STUN server IPs can be provisioned.

setting.name: STUN_SERVER_PORT2
setting.description: is the port number used corresponding to STUN_SERVER_IP2. The default port number is 3478.

setting.name: DNS_DOMAIN
setting.description: Please enter valid DNS host name or IP address, for example server.domain.org, 10.1.1.25

setting.name: DSCP_CONTROL
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format between -1 and 63. If the value is -1, the DSCP value is picked up by the Service Package. The default value is 40.

setting.name: DSCP_MEDIA
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format between -1 and 63 representing the DSCP value in the Real-time Transfer Protocol packets. If the value is -1, the DSCP value is retrieved from the Service Package. The default value is 44. x - a value from -1 to 63 indicating the DSCP value.

setting.name: DSCP_DATA
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format between -1 and 63 representing the DSCP value in the provisioning packets. If the value is -1, the DSCP value is retrieved from the Service Package. The default value is 40. x - a value from -1 to 63 indicating the DSCP value.

setting.name: 802.1P_CONTROL
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format between -1 and 7 representing the 802.1P value in the SIP signaling packets. If the value is -1, the 802.1P value is retrieved from the Service Package. The default value is 6. x - the value from -1 to 7 indicating the 802.1P value.

setting.name: 802.1P_MEDIA
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format between -1 and 7 representing the 802.1P value in the IP Phone 1140 Media (RTP) packets. If the value is -1 then the 802.1P value is retrieved from the Service Package is the 802.1 setting for media Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP). The default value is -1. x - a value from -1 to 7 indicating the 802.1P value.

setting.name: 802.1P_DATA
setting.description: is a value entered in decimal format between -1 and 7 representing the 802.1P value in the provisioning packets. If the value is -1, the 802.1P value is retrieved from the Service Package. The default value is 6. x - a value from -1 to 7 indicating the 802.1P value.

setting.name: VQMON_PUBLISH
setting.description: is the command that is used to enable or disable the publish message containing the voice quality monitoring metrics sent to the Proactive Voice Quality Monitoring (PVQMoN) collecting server. YES - enables VQMoN. NO - disables VQMoN. NO is the default.

setting.name: VQMON_PUBLISH_IP
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address for PVQMoN server, for example: 10.1.1.0.It is used to set the IP address of the PVQMoN server that collects voice quality monitoring metrics from the publish message. This IP address is used within the report only.

setting.name: LISTENING_R_ENABLE
setting.description: is used to enable or disable the alerts based on the Listening R Minor and Major Thresholds. The default value is vocoder-dependent using a scale from 1 (lowest quality) to 100 (highest quality). Currently default values are used based on VOCODER on a per call basis as summarized below. YES - enables the sending of the alert report based on the Listening R Value. NO - disables the sending of the alert report based on the Listening R Value.

setting.name: LISTENING_R_WARN
setting.description: is the threshold to send a report on Listening R less than [xx]. The default value is 70. Using 0 will reset it to default based on far end VOCODER. xx - is an INTEGER value used as threshold.

setting.name: LISTENING_R_EXCE
setting.description: is the threshold to send a report on Listening R less than [xx]. The default value is 60. Using 0 will reset it to default based on far end VOCODER. xx - is an INTEGER value used as threshold.

setting.name: PACKET_LOSS_ENABLE
setting.description: is used to enable or disable the alerts based on the packet loss thresholds. Packet loss is the fraction of RTP data packets from the source lost since the beginning of reception. The value is an integer scaled by 256. The range is 1 to 25600. YES - enables the sending of alert report based on the packet loss NO - disables the sending of alert report based on the packet loss

setting.name: PACKET_LOSS_WARN
setting.description: is the threshold to send a report on Packet Loss greater than [xx]. The default is 256 (1%). Using 0 will reset the threshold to default. xx - is an INTEGER value scaled by 256 that is used as threshold. The range is 1 to 25600.

setting.name: PACKET_LOSS_EXCE
setting.description: is the threshold to send a report on Packet Loss greater than [xx]. The default is 1280 (5%). Using 0 will reset the threshold to default. xx - is an INTEGER value scaled by 256 that is used as threshold. The range is 1 to 25600.

setting.name: JITTER_ENABLE
setting.description: is used to enable or disable alerts based on the inter-arrival Jitter on incoming RTP packets inter-arrival time. The value is represented in 1/65536 of a second. YES - enables the sending of alert report based on jitter detection NO - disables the sending of alert report based on jitter detection

setting.name: JITTER_WARN
setting.description: is the threshold to send a report on Inter-arrival Jitter greater than [xx]. 1 second is broken up into 65535 (0xffff hex) parts. [xx] / 65535 is the threshold in seconds. The default is 3276 (50 ms). Using 0 will reset the threshold to default. xx - is an INTEGER value used as threshold

setting.name: JITTER_EXCE
setting.description: is the threshold to send a report on Inter-arrival Jitter greater than [xx]. 1 second is broken up into 65535 (0xffff hex) parts. [xx] / 65535 is the threshold in seconds. The default is 32760 (500 ms). Using 0 will reset the threshold to default. xx - is an INTEGER value used as threshold

setting.name: DELAY_ENABLE
setting.description: is used to enable or disable the alerts based on the excessive delay detection. This is the one-way delay (including system delay) for the call, measured in milliseconds. YES - enables Excessive delay detection. NO - disables Excessive delay detection

setting.name: DELAY_WARN
setting.description: is the threshold to give warning on Excessive Delay greater than [xx]. The default is 150 ms. Using 0 will reset the threshold to default. xx - is an INTEGER value used as a threshold measured in 1/1000 of a second

setting.name: DELAY_EXCE
setting.description: is the threshold to report unacceptable Excessive Delay greater than [xx]. The default is 175 ms. Using 0 will reset the threshold to default. xx - is an INTEGER value used as a threshold measured in 1/1000 of a second.

setting.name: SESSION_RPT_INT
setting.description: is used to enable or disable periodic VQMon session reports. The default is disabled. Both session report enable and session report interval must be set if the phone firmware has been upgraded to SIP Release 2.0. Otherwise, the SESSION_RPT_INT default of 60 seconds will be used automatically. YES - enables periodic VQMon session reports. NO - disables periodic VQMon session reports. Default is NO.

setting.name: SRTP_MODE
setting.description: Please select the offer type

setting.name: SRTP_CIPHER_1
setting.description: Crypto Suite. Allows the administor to choose which SRTP ciphers should be negotiated and their order of preference.

setting.name: SRTP_CIPHER_2
setting.description: Crypto Suite. Allows the administor to choose which SRTP ciphers should be negotiated and their order of preference.

setting.name: MKI_ENABLE
setting.description: YES -Enable MKI for SRTP; NO-Disable MKI for SRTP (Default).

setting.name: SECURE_UI_ENABLE
setting.description: addresses from the user on the display (1: on, 0: off)Configure the availability of other sensitive data that may need to be hidden from the normal end-user:such as IP address/MAC address on the phone information screen, and the FE IP Address and Port on the audio quality

setting.name: LOGIN_NOTIFY
setting.description: Display last login's success or failure status (SUCCESS, FAILURE, BOTH, OFF). (Note the parameter updates - different from your original set of parameters.)Allows the administrator to enable/ disable the ability to turn on the Last Success Full Login and Last Unsuccessful login banner. Off - don't show either banner. Success - Show the last successful username that logged in. Failure - Show the last unsuccessful login attempt. Both - show both.

setting.name: SPEEDLIST_LABEL
setting.description: String used for SDL key label

setting.name: SPEEDLIST_KEY_INDEX
setting.description: Programmable key to be used for Speed Dial List (default = 0) use value greater than 1 to set Speed Dial List Key the value used must be a valid programmable key index. In other words, setting the index to 5 on an 1120 will NOT display an SDL key (unless set has a GEM attached).

setting.name: USER_FILE_ENABLE
setting.description: Enables or disables the download of User specific configuration file

setting.name: DEFAULT_ADDRESSBOOK_FILE
setting.description: specifies the phone specific addressbook filename to use when downloading provisionable files , they are used if not overriden by user.cfg

setting.name: DEFAULT_SPEEDDIALLIST_FILE
setting.description: specifies the phone specific speedlist filename to use when downloading provisionable files , they are used if not overriden by user.cfg

setting.name: DEFAULT_CUSTOMKEYS_FILE
setting.description: specifies the phone specific customekeys filename to use when downloading provisionable files , they are used if not overriden by user.cfg

setting.name: ENABLE_SERVICE_PACKAGE
setting.description: YES - Phone will try to download service package, NO - phone will not subscribe to service package. Default: YES For SCS the default value is NO because SCS doesnot provide a Service Package

setting.name: SERVICE_PACKAGE_PROTOCOL
setting.description: HTTP - Phone will retrieve service package using HTTP; HTTPS - phone will retrieve service package using HTTPS.

setting.name: SESSION_TIMER_ENABLE
setting.description: Enable or disable Session Timer

setting.name: SESSION_TIMER_DEFAULT_SE
setting.description: Default Session Expiration value set in initial session request

setting.name: SESSION_TIMER_MIN_SE
setting.description: Default Minimum Session Expiration value set in initial session request

setting.name: SET_REQ_REFRESHER
setting.description: Set Refresher parameter in session request. 0 -- Not Set, 1--uac, 2-uas

setting.name: SET_RESP_REFRESHER
setting.description: Set Refresher parameter in the response. 0 -- Not Set (only valid when SET_REQ_REFRESHER is not equal to 0), 1--uac, 2-uas

setting.name: MAX_INBOX_ENTRIES
setting.description: is used to restrict the maximum number of inbox entries and takes a number as a parameter. For example 100 limits the number of entries in the inbox to 100. The default limit is 100

setting.name: MAX_OUTBOX_ENTRIES
setting.description: is used to restrict the maximum number of outbox entries and takes a number as a parameter. For example 100 limits the number of entries in the outbox to 100. The default limit is 100

setting.name: MAX_REJECTREASONS
setting.description: is used to restrict the maximum number of Call Decline Reasons (Prefs, Feature Options, Call Decline Reasons) and takes a number as a parameter. The default limit is 20.

setting.name: MAX_CALLSUBJECT
setting.description: is used to restrict the maximum number of call subjects (Prefs, Feature Options, Call Subject) and takes a number as a parameter. the default limit is 20

setting.name: MAX_PRESENCENOTE
setting.description: is used to restrict the maximum number of presence notes and takes a number as a parameter. The default limit is 20.

setting.name: MAX_IM_ENTRIES
setting.description: is used to set the maximum number of instant message (IM) entries and takes a number as a parameter. Once the maximum number is reached, the oldest IM is deleted without any user notification. The default limit is 999.

setting.name: MAX_ADDR_BOOK_ENTRIES
setting.description: is used to set the maximum number of entries in the address book and takes a number as a parameter. The default limit is 100.

setting.name: TIMEZONE_OFFSET
setting.description: is used to set the current time zone offset from GMT in seconds. TIMEZONE_OFFSET takes a number as a parameter. For example, TIMEZONE_OFFSET -25200 sets the time zone offset to MST, which is GMT-7 (-7*3600 = -25200 seconds)

setting.name: FORCE_TIME_ZONE
setting.description: allows you to force the timezone offset on each user’s IP Phone 1140E. YES - forces the IP Phone to use the TIMEZONE_OFFSET specified in the device configuration file. NO - uses the value stored in the user preferences

setting.name: SNTP_ENABLE
setting.description: allows the IP Phone 1140E to obtain the time and date from an NTP server. The default is NO. The IP Phone 1140E updates the time once every 24 hours from the NTP server. If the IP Phone 1140E cannot contact the server, the IP Phone 1140E tries every 15 minutes up to a maximum of 6 attempts, and then hourly attempts are made. If SNTP_ENABLE is set to NO the IP Phone 1140E tries to retrieve the time and date from the SIP proxy server. However, not all SIP proxy servers support this method of retrieving the time and date. YES - enables NTP. NO - disables NT

setting.name: SNTP_SERVER
setting.description: Please enter a valid IPv4 address, for example: 10.1.1.0

setting.name: DST_ENABLED
setting.description: enables and disables the daylight saving time mechanism. The time received from the server is GMT and is converted to the proper timezone by the IP Phone 1140E. If the Daylight Saving Time feature is enabled, the IP Phone 1140E automatically calculates the DST time at the appropriate date and converts the time to and from DST. The calculations used are based on the new rules applicable to DST in 2007. The IP Phone 1140E is set up to use the North American DST scheme. YES - enables daylight savings time. NO - disables daylight savings time

setting.name: DIAL_TONE
setting.description: used to select the tone advising the caller that the exchange is ready to receive call information and invites the user to start sending call information. You can select the country specific tone. The default tone is the North American tone. frequency1 - the frequency of tone 1. frequency2 - the frequency of tone 2. on_time - the duration of the tone when it is on. A -1 indicates a continuous tone. off_time - the duration when no tone is played. The following are examples of DIAL_TONE: 1. 350,440;-1 (350 and 440 Hz continuous tone)

setting.name: RINGING_TONE
setting.description: is used to select the tone advising the caller that a connection is made and a calling signal is applied to a telephone number or service point. You can select the country specific tone. The default tone is the North American tone. frequency1 - the frequency of tone 1. frequency2 - the frequency of tone 2. on_time - the duration of the tone when it is on. A -1 indicates a continuous tone. off_time - the duration when no tone is played. The following are examples of RINGING_TONE: 1. 440,480; 2000,4000 (440 and 480 Hz with 2 seconds on, 4 seconds off)

setting.name: BUSY_TONE
setting.description: is used to select the tone advising the caller that the telephone number is busy. You can select the country specific tone. The default tone is the North American tone. frequency1 - the frequency of tone 1. frequency2 - the frequency of tone 2. on_time - the duration of the tone when it is on. A -1 indicates a continuous tone. off_time - the duration when no tone is played.

setting.name: FASTBUSY_TONE
setting.description: is used to select the tone advising the caller that the telephone number is busy. It is fast in cadence or frequency. You can select the country specific tone. The default tone is the North American tone. frequency1 - the frequency of tone 1. frequency2 - the frequency of tone 2. on_time - the duration of the tone when it is on. A -1 indicates a continuous tone. off_time - the duration when no tone is played.

setting.name: CONGESTION_TONE
setting.description: is used to select the tone advising the caller that the groups of lines or switching equipment necessary for setting up the required call, or for the use of a specific service, are temporarily engaged. You can select the country specific tone. The default tone is the North American tone. frequency1 - the frequency of tone 1. frequency2 - the frequency of tone 2. on_time - the duration of the tone when it is on. A -1 indicates a continuous tone. off_time - the duration when no tone is played. The IP Phone 1140E supports using WAV files to replace the ringtone Frequency/Cadence pattern. For a system-wide setting, the country default values can be used

setting.name: MENU_AUTO_BACKOUT
setting.description: Used to set the auto back-out time on newly created profiles.

setting.name: SCRNSVR_ENABLE
setting.description: Used to completely disable the screensaver feature. If set to N, the screensaver UI will not be available to users, and the screensaver will be disabled on the IP phone.

setting.name: SCRNSVR_UNPRTCTD_ENABLE
setting.description: Used to enable/disable the UI for setting the screensaver without a password.

setting.name: SCRNSVR_MODE
setting.description: Used to enable/disable the ability for the user to set a screensaver password (less secure simpler password used only for the screensaver feature).

setting.name: SCRNSVR_DELAY
setting.description: Used to set the delay in minutes for the display screensaver for newly created profiles.

setting.name: SCRNSVR_TEXT
setting.description: Used to set the text to be displayed on the screensaver of newly created profiles.

setting.name: SCRNSVR_IMAGE
setting.description: Used to set the background image file for the display screen saver of newly created profiles. If the specified file does not exist in the IMAGES folder of the IP phone, no background image will be used for the screensaver. Changing this flag’s value for profiles already created has no effect.

setting.name: BG_IMAGE_ENABLE
setting.description: Used to set the background image file for the display. If the specified file does not exist in the IMAGES folder of the IP phone, no background image will be used for the display.

setting.name: BG_IMG_SELECT_ENABLE
setting.description: User to allow users to change the selected background image for the display. If the flag is set to N, the UI to change the BG image will be hidden from the user locking the currently set image as the BG image of the IP phone.

setting.name: USE_BG_IMAGE
setting.description: Used to set the device's background image on newly created profiles. If image file does not exist on phone, no image would be used. Changing this flag’s value for profiles already created has no effect.

setting.name: BANNER
setting.description: preconfigures the banner on the IP Phone 1140E. Use a text string to set the banner. For example, BANNER ABC Company sets the banner to ABC Company. The text string can have a maximum of 24 characters

setting.name: FORCE_BANNER
setting.description: is set by the system administrator through the configuration file. If FORCE_BANNER is set to YES, the banner from the configuration file is reloaded each time the IP Phone 1140E powers up, even if the user changes the banner manually. YES - causes the banner set by the administrator to override any banner set by the user. NO - allows the user to set the banner

setting.name: LOGIN_BANNER_ENABLE
setting.description: If enabled, this flag will cause the login of the primary user to display the provisioned banner text as part of the login process.
